turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Well, we can't go anywhere in this darkness.  How long till dawn?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Well... this rock rotates every two hours.  The sun should be coming up in about 20 minutes.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Just settle down.  Sandy, you get any response yet?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Sorry.  Nothing but that same damn transmission, every 32 seconds.  I've tried every frequency on the spectrum.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Receiving.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: All right.  Now just remember: keep away from those weapons unless I say otherwise.  Martin, do you read me?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: That way.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: You lead.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: My signal's fading.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: It's close, real close.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: How far?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: We should be almost on top of it.  I just can't quite...

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Air lock?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Who knows?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Doesn't seem much doubt about it, does there?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: That creature sure must have considered it important... using his last strength to draw it...

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: This looks ancient.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Can't tell -- these weather conditions could erode anything, fast.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: What'd he say?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: I couldn't make it out -- too much interference.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: If we don't hear from him soon, I think we better go in after him.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Sun will be down in a minute.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Here's his line.  We can haul him out of there if we have to.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: It'll yank him right off his feet if he's not expecting it.  The line could get tangled in something.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: But what can we do?  He's out of radio contact.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Maybe we should just wait a few more minutes.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: There, it caught!

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Is it still coming up, or is it hooked on something?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: No, it's coming.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Can you see anything?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: <u>What is it</u>?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: <u>Don't touch him, watch it</u>!

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Oh God, oh God no.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Help me -- I'm going to try to get it off.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: It won't come -- it's stuck.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: How the hell should I know?  Come on, give me a hand, let's get him out of there!

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: It's not coming off -- not without his whole face coming off too.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Let's let the machine work on him.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: It's stopped?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Yes, thank heaven.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: We're just plain lucky.  That could have gone right through the hull -- taken <u>weeks</u> to patch it.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Reminded me of when I was a kid and the roof leaked -- everybody running for the pots and pans.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: No, thank God... just missed him.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Is it still dripping?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: It appears to have healed itself.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: That sounds a little fanciful...

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Primitive pictorial languages are based on common objects in the environment, and this can be used as a starting point for translation...

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Too primitive.  It's a pre- technological construction.  That slab was engineered by an Iron-Age culture at best.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: They're from a dead civilization; they're spores from a tomb.  God knows how long they've been here.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: We're going home.  We're in hyperspace.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: We're going into the freezers now.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: I'm going to write a book about this expedition.  I'm going to call it "The Snark Log."

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: The commander normally has first publication rights.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Maybe we could write it together.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: We'll have to catch it and eject it from the ship.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Well, I kind of hate to point it out, but all our supplies are based on us spending a strictly limited amount of time out of suspended animation... and as you know, we used up most of that time in harvesting.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: We've got about a week left, right?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Room by room, corridor by corridor.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: And what do we do when we find it?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: We'll have to trap it somehow.  If we had a really strong piece of net, we could bag it.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: I thought I'd find you here.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: I was thinking of a line from an old poem: "Water, water everywhere, but not a drop to drink."  All that space out there, and we're trapped in this ship.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: That's the one about the albatross, right?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: We can't even radio for help; the carrier wave wouldn't reach its destination till long after we'd died and turned to dust.  We are utterly, absolutely alone.  Can anybody really visualize such a scale of distances?  Halfway across Creation...

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: We came out there, we'll go back.  A long time by the clock, but a short time to us.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Time and space have no meaning out here.  We're living in Einsteinian equation.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: I can see you're putting your spare time to good use.  Let me tell you something: you keep staring at hyperspace for long enough, they'll be peeling you off a wall.  I've seen it happen.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: We're the new pioneers, Chaz.  We even have our own special diseases.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Come on -- let's go above and see how they're coming with the gear.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: I've got Hunter... and something else as well, in front of him.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Are they close?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: They're on the next level up.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Let's get moving with this net.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: They're getting pretty close now.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: All right, then -- when it gets to the other side of the door, you sing out, then drop the door.  Okay?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: And you and I will bag it, and then we'll take it to the ventral air lock, got it?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Men have waited centuries to contact another form of intelligent life in the universe.  This is an opportunity which may never come again.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Look --

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: My God, it's stormy for a piece of rock that size!

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Just a second.  Those aren't water vapor clouds; they have no moisture content.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Source of transmission is to the northeast... about 300 meters.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Close...

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: It appears to be a heavy fluid of some sort... it blocks the X-rays...

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: That tube must be depositing it in him.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Could be some kind of venom, or poison...

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: These day and night cycles are totally disorienting.  I feel like we've been here for days, but it's only been how long?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: About four hours.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: We do know that.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: They never made it off the planet. The parasites won.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: No.  It's just too small to support fauna as big as the parasites.  If there were a native ecology, it would have to be microscopic.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Couldn't the pyramid have been built here by space travellers?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: First thing I'm going to do when we get back is eat some biological food.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: What's the matter, you don't like this stuff?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Tastes like something you'd feed a chicken to make it lay more eggs.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: All right, tycoons, let's stop spending our credit and start worrying about the job at hand.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Right.  Fire up all systems.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Where are we?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Sandy, contact traffic control.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: This is Chaz speaking.  Sorry, but we are not home.  Our present location seems to be only halfway to Irth. Remain at your posts and stand by. That is all.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Chaz, I've got something here on my security alert.  A high priority from the computer...

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Let's hear it.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Computer, you have signalled a priority three message.  What is the message?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Oh my God.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Well, it's finally happened.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: It's out of focus.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: No -- that's atmosphere.  Cloud layer.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Atmospheric turbulence.  Dust storm.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Turn on navigation lights.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: What the hell happened?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Engine room, what happened?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Yeah, okay.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Sandy... how far are we from the source of the transmission?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: 10% argon, 85% nitrogen, 5% neon... and some trace elements.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Nontoxic... but unbreathable. Pressure?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Ten to the fourth dynes per square centimeter.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Good!  Moisture content?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Zero.  Dry as a bone.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Any microorganisms?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Not a one.  It's dead.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Anything else?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Yeah, rock particles.  Dust.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Well, we won't need pressure suits, but breathing masks are called for. Sandy -- can you rig up some kind of portable unit that we can use to follow that transmission to its source?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Okay, Chaz, I hear you.  I've got you on my board.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Good.  I'm getting you clear too. Let's just keep the line open.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Martin, uh, we've found it.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Found what?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: It appears to be some sort of spacecraft.  We're going to approach it.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Martin?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: I agree.  This is the single most important discovery in history.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: But?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: What killed it?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Find anything we missed?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: I don't even know what I'm looking for.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Still worried?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Oh well... you know me.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: I've always respected your opinion, Martin.  If something worries you, it worries me.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: What would you say that was supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Well... it's obviously intentional... some kind of attempt at communication... maybe it's a symbol that means something to them...

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: But why draw it on the wall?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: This ship is full of cat hair.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Tell you what, Martin.  As soon as the engine's fixed --

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Hey, can you guys hear me?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Yeah, we hear you!  We're coming back!

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Thank Christ!  We lost you!  Listen, there's been a new development --

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Can't talk now; Broussard's injured. We'll need some help getting him into the ship.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Here, Chaz.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: We're coming up now, open the outer lock door.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Chaz -- what happened to Broussard?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: It's some kind of organism, it's attached itself to him.  Let us in.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: You hear me, Martin?  Open the outer door.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Chaz, if it's an organism, and we let it in, the ship will be infected.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: We can't leave him out here, open the door.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Chaz, listen to me -- we've broken every rule of quarantine.  If we bring an organism on board, we won't have a single layer of defense left.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Martin, this is an order!  Open the door!

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: I understand why you did that.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Would somebody fill me in?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: He went into the pyramid alone.  We lost radio contact with him.  When we pulled him out, it was on his face. It won't come off, not without injuring him.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: What film?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Broussard had film in his datastick, didn't he?  We can see what happened to him.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Look at these suckers -- no wonder we couldn't get it off him.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Is that its mouth?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: I'm sorry to say it looks like you were right in the first place, Martin.  We never should have landed here.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Look, I'm not trying to rub anybody's nose in anything.  The important thing is just to get away from here as fast as possible.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: I can't lean on Faust any harder -- he's been working non-stop on the engines.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: If we knew exactly what happened to the beings on the other ship --

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Where did the parasites come from?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: They seem native to the planet.  It's got an atmosphere and a dense gravity.  It's dead now, but once it must have been fertile.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Take us up.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Up one kilometer, Jay.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Engaged.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Let's take her into an escape orbit.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: We made it!  Damn, we made it!

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: You bet we made it.  Martin, set course for Irth and accelerate us into stardrive.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: With great pleasure.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: That's the part that always makes me feel like I'm gonna puke -- when we accelerate into light speed.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Quit complaining; we're in space.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: I think the best thing to do with Broussard is to just freeze him as he is.  It'll arrest the progress of his disease, and he can get complete medical attention when we get back to the Colonies.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: We'll have to go into quarantine, maybe for quite a while.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: That's okay, he can remain in hypersleep until they're ready to treat him.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: We won't need it then.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: All right, so that's what we've got. A week.  It's plenty of time.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: But if we <u>haven't</u> caught it in a week, then we have to go into the freezers anyway.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: These will be very useful.  At least we won't have to go digging around in closets with our bare hands.  All right, here's the battle plan: we're going to break into two teams and start systematically covering the ship.  Whoever finds it first, catches it in the net and ejects it from the nearest airlock.  Clear?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Even simple.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: We've got it up here!  It's trapped! Get up here fast!

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Food-storage room!

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: We're coming!

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: What's it doing, having a seizure?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: It started crashing around right after we locked it in.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: I guess we open the door and net it.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Hey, wait a minute!  That's all our food supplies in there!  We can't pump poison gas all over them!

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Once we kill the thing we won't need the food any more -- we can go straight into hypersleep.  Also, it sounds like that thing is already doing a pretty good job on our supplies; it may be fouling them all.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: You win.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: This stuff's deadly -- I hope we know what we're doing.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Go ahead, Jay.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: What do you think?  Now we go in.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Are you <u>crazy</u>?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: The man would need protection, obviously -- as well as some way to drive the thing before him.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: So the only question left is: who gets to crawl down the airshaft?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Let's be democratic.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: That's a flip-flop gate to channel the air, but we can use it to trap the thing.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Right now let's keep it closed.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: How did it get so <u>big</u>?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: By eating our food supplies.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Two down, four to go.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: What's that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Can you make out any pattern in all that?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Well... yes... there's a pattern... but it's meaningless to me.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: I know it looks like a senseless jumble, but if you look closely, there are recognizable forms.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: That next thing there -- six legs, tentacles -- that's the thing we saw in the food locker.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: So the next step should be --

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: This is all the same creature.  We're seeing the different stages in its life-cycle.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Then that tomb... must have been some kind of fertility temple... where they stored their eggs, and maybe held mating rituals...

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Which presumably means...

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: ... More spores coming.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: I saw it.  Faust got himself jammed in the air lock door.  His body held it open.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Can we get to him?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: No, I had to seal off a whole section.  We'd lose too much of our remaining air if we opened the connecting door.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Poor kitty; puss puss puss.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: At least we're rid of the damn monster.  It must have been the first thing sucked out of the ship.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: No such luck.  I saw it running down one of the corridors.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: It was time for that a couple days ago.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: That kind of remark is pointless. Now come on -- I want to hear every suggestion you can come up with, no matter how wild.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Let's hear it.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Okay.  First we shut down all the cooling systems on the stardrive engines.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: That'll blow the ship up.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Right... but it'll take a few minutes for the engines to overheat and melt down the core.  In the meantime, we get in the lifeboat and leave the ship.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: But the lifeboat can't accelerate to light speed.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Doesn't matter -- we're already at light speed.  And when we get back to the Colonies, they'll pick us up in the network.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: No, it won't work and I just realized why.  There's only one hypersleep freezer on the lifeboat. Only one of us could survive.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Yeah... I forgot.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: But the idea's good, if we could just turn it around somehow.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: You know, it's funny -- this stuff we went to so much trouble to dig up -- this treasure, the paydirt -- it'll make it back to Irth just fine -- even if we're not with it.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Here, carry these.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: <u>Hey watch it</u>!

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: It's stable; it doesn't hurt to drop it.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: So what do we do?  Do we ignore it and finish loading the explosives into the boat -- or do we flush it out now?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Now.  If we can get it into the boat, we won't have to blow it up -- we can just eject it into space.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Yes, and maybe launch the boat and blow it too... if the others are injured.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Who gets the privilege?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: All right, Martin, we'll be in touch with you on the communicator.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: And you'll let me know when you've got it coming this way...

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: And you stand aside while we drive it in, then shut the hatch, launch the boat, and --

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Kablooey.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Kill me...

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: What did it do to you?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Look...

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: That was Melkonis... it ate Hunter...

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: I'll get you out of there.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: No... don't...

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: But I can save you -- get you to the Autodoc!

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: No good... it's eaten too much of me...

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: What can I do?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Kill me...

turns.speaker: REVNA
turns.text: Headache?  Dehydration?

turns.speaker: ACKLAND
turns.text: The head's okay, but I could sink a six-pack.

turns.speaker: REVNA
turns.text: Forget that.  I want you off alcohol for at least seventy-two hours. I've got some toxin build-up tests still to run.

turns.speaker: ACKLAND
turns.text: Can I... um... have some water?  Please?

turns.speaker: REVNA
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: REVNA
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: ACKLAND
turns.text: It's nothing, Doc.  Just a... touch of indigestion... something.

turns.speaker: REVNA
turns.text: Do you want a tablet?

turns.speaker: REVNA
turns.text: Better?

turns.speaker: ACKLAND
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: ACKLAND
turns.text: Me either.  I tell you, I used to be with a mining outfit on Callisto, and when something like that hits... believe me, you know about it.

turns.speaker: YORK
turns.text: Do you wanna head back and call it in?
